clinical_study.brief_title: PD1 Antibody Toripalimab and Chemoradiotherapy for dMMR/MSI-H Locally Advanced Colorectal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: PD1 Antibody Toripalimab and Chemoradiotherapy for dMMR/MSI-H Locally Advanced Colorectal Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: PD1 antibody is now recommended for dMMR/MSI-H metastatic colorectal cancer patients as second line. Chemoradiotherapy is standand treatment for locally advanced rectal cancer and is also recommended as an alternative choice for unresectable locally advanced colon cancer. Thus, this study will investigate the efficacy and toxicity of combination strategy using PD1 antibody and chemoradiotherapy for dMMR/MSI-H locally advnaced colorectal cancer patients.

detailed_description.textblock: PD1 antibody is recommended for dMMR/MSI-H metastatic colorectal cancer patients as second line. Chemoradiotherapy is standand treatment for locally advanced rectal cancer and is also recommended as an alternative choice for unresectable locally advanced colon cancer. Thus, this phase II, single arm study will investigate the efficacy and toxicity of combination strategy using PD1 antibody and chemoradiotherapy for dMMR/MSI-H locally advnaced colorectal cancer patients, which is expected to yield higher tumor regressiona with tolerable toxicity.

primary_outcome.description: According to pathological response to assess the efficiency of treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 months after adjuvant treatment
Surgery scheduled 6-8 weeks after the end of neoadjuvant treatment
From date of randomization until the date of local recurrence, assessed up to 10 years
From date of randomization until the date of death of distant metastasis, assessed up to 10 years
From date of randomization until the date of disease recurrence, assessed up to 3 years
